website_summaries.verdict: One of the best, highly detailed boat model kits that requires more advanced modeling skills.
pros: Large model sections can be painted with a custom design using separate modeling paint
Smaller pieces feature a great amount of authentic detail
cons: The skill requirement for assembling the model is not friendly to beginning modelers

customer_reviews.title: and will be a great addition to the WW II naval builder's collection
customer_reviews.text: The model is a newly molded remale of the 1960s era kit. It has much more realistic details, and will be a great addition to the WW II naval builder's collection. There are even detailed interior parts that the old kit didn't have.
customer_reviews.author: M.N.

customer_reviews.title: A very good product
customer_reviews.text: This would have been an even better product if the seller had packaged it for it's journey. The box arrived mashed, and partially torn open. The kit box was partially flattened. I have not, as yet been able to determine if any of the actual model pieces have been damaged. On the positive side, the instructions are something to write about. Detailed, and very clear. I anticipate not problems following them. I am glad I did not order glue with this order. It would have been all over both boxes and the model itself.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Guzowsky

customer_reviews.title: but so far the kit's detail is good, as well as the fit of the parts
customer_reviews.text: New tool kit from Revell Germany, not to be confused by the old Revell kit from the sixties, which is still available. I haven't finished building mine, but so far the kit's detail is good, as well as the fit of the parts. Many details were added that are not available in the older kit, mainly the 37mm anti-tank gun Kennedy put on his boat.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Son of a Sailor
customer_reviews.text: The model was fortunate to arrive in just 280 pieces, instead of a million pieces LOL. The box it came in delivered was obliterated. Once again, I was lucky none of the plastic pieces in the box were damaged. Other than that, it was fun to assemble. If you like putting models together. I have ever since I was young lad. Me father was in the Royal Navy you see. I grew up putting WW II plastic models of numerous types together. It's a creative way to pass the time. Ye lads and lassies tell me what ye thinkest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The smile on my grandsons face made my day! He was thrilled to get this - he is a huge history nut.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Libsack

customer_reviews.title: Learning about the past history and the engineering that went into building vessels
customer_reviews.text: I like to build things and learn about the nomenclature of parts and teach others about the history of the items and the parts and the engineering that went into building
customer_reviews.author: tammy torres

customer_reviews.title: Revelle PT 109
customer_reviews.text: Great kit better than the old 1963 kit Nice weekend project
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ENJOYED
customer_reviews.text: LIKED THE MODEL THE TOWN WHERE THEY WERE BUILT I LIVED IN. GOOD TIME PUTTING TOGETHER.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: take your time with it
customer_reviews.text: some parts were too small, I will buy the bigger version when I have the money too.
customer_reviews.author: fish fifer

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: A large scale for a small subject. Very few fiddly parts and a beautiful representation of the PT-109. Easy build. Great kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mass buyer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Great detail, fairly straight forward to make, although some parts of the instructions were confusing.
customer_reviews.author: GN Douglas
